summary: Nancy P Schultz was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). She is mentioned in several payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to November 1978. These documents list her name, position, and salary information as part of the committee's staff. The documents indicate her continuous employment with the HSCA during this period.
significance: Nancy P Schultz's significance lies in her role as a staff member of the HSCA, contributing to the investigation of the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her work is not detailed in these documents, her presence on the payroll and certification reports confirms her involvement in the committee's operations.
